networks.name: acala
networks.description: Acala is the all-in-one DeFi hub of Polkadot. Acala is an Ethereum-compatible platform for financial applications to use smart contracts or built-in protocols with out-of-the-box cross-chain capabilities and robust security.

networks.name: aleph-zero
networks.description: Aleph Zero is a public blockchain that has been designed to offer powerful, scalable and open source infrastructure layer. Testnet is a part of development process. In this network, new features will be tested by the community.

networks.name: aleph-zero-testnet
networks.description: Aleph Zero is a public blockchain that has been designed to offer powerful, scalable and open source infrastructure layer. Testnet is a part of development process. In this network, new features will be tested by the community.

networks.name: altair
networks.description: Altair combines the industry-leading infrastructure built by Centrifuge to finance real-world assets (RWA) on Centrifuge Chain, with the newest experimental features — before they go live on Centrifuge Chain.

networks.name: amplitude
networks.description: Amplitude is as a canary network of its sister blockchain Pendulum. It will act as a testing ground for applications and network parameters for Pendulum. Unlike a traditional testnet, users can interact on the Amplitude chain with real financial consequences. Lots of novel ways of utilizing fiat on DeFi can be experimented with. Amplitude chain will be powered by its native AMPE token.

networks.name: astar
networks.description: Astar is a Substrate Runtime Module Library which allows developers to add Plasma functions to their Substrate chain.

networks.name: bajun
networks.description: The Bajun Network will be fully functional and host games. It will be mainly used for testing and introducing new Ajuna features, services,  and functionalities. This will provide a fastmoving environment for development and testing.

networks.name: basilisk
networks.description: Basilisk is not a mere canary network of HydraDX - it is an independent chain which has the mission to enable frictionless liquidity bootstrapping for new cryptoassets.

networks.name: bifrost
networks.description: Bifrost developed a Staking Liquidity Protocol called SLP that allows you to get vTokens for operations and delivering liquidity, plus you got staking rewards for your DOT, KSM, EOS or other token that is otherwise locked by the Staking Mechanism.

networks.name: bifrost-polkadot
networks.description: Bifrost developed a Staking Liquidity Protocol called SLP that allows you to get vTokens for operations and delivering liquidity, plus you got staking rewards for your DOT, KSM, EOS or other token that is otherwise locked by the Staking Mechanism.

networks.name: bitcountry-pioneer
networks.description: Bit.Country enables everyone to start their own metaverse for their people with the 3D world, NFTs, play-to-earn & build communities to earn, and takes community engagement to a new dimension on web3.0.

networks.name: calamari
networks.description: Calamari Network is the plug-and-play privacy-preservation protocol built to service the entire DeFi stack on Kusama (and Manta Network on Polkadot).

networks.name: centrifuge
networks.description: Centrifuge unlocks economic opportunity for all by connecting people to borrow and lend money transparently and cost-effectively.

networks.name: cere
networks.description: The World's First Decentralized Data Cloud

networks.name: clover
networks.description: Clover is a substrate based smart contract platform built for Polkadot, with added support for Ethereum developers to participate in the Polkadot ecosystem.

networks.name: collectives
networks.description: The team at Parity develops a new parachain for collectives and plans to make a governance proposal to connect it to Polkadot. The Collectives chain hosts on-chain collectives that serve the Polkadot network.

networks.name: composable-finance
networks.description: Composable’s parachain is going to be able to run multiple bytecodes together in the same place, in order to run smart contracts together in a manner that allows them to communicate and collaborate. As a result, protocols using different smart contract languages (i.e. those on different chains, especially) will be able to unite via our parachain, facilitating cross-chain asset swaps and other functionalities.

networks.name: crab
networks.description: Crab is a programmable cross-chain platform for Dapps. It is substrate based, EVM-compatible, and connected to Kusama.

networks.name: crust
networks.description: Crust implements the incentive layer protocol for decentralized storage. It is adaptable to multiple storage layer protocols such as IPFS, and provides support for the application layer.

networks.name: darwinia
networks.description: Darwinia is a trustless multi-chain bridge hub network designed to become the foundational layer for the next generation of Web3.0 dapps and games. Darwinia Network uses a combination of ZK proofs and optimistic challenge technology to provide the most secure general bridging solution between heterogeneous chains such as Polkadot, Ethereum, Polygon, and BSC, without the need for custodial vaults or wrapping of tokens, so is also compatible with zero-liquidity assets such as NFTs.

networks.name: dorafactory
networks.description: The DAO-as-a-Service Infrastructure for Decentralized Governance and Open Source Ventures.

networks.name: debionetwork
networks.description: DeBio Network allows users to sample and test anonymously, without leaving home. Empower labs of all sizes to collaborate on analyzing genetic and medical data, and offering joint biomedical products.

networks.name: efinity
networks.description: Efinity is a decentralized cross-chain token network built with Substrate that gives users the tools to create, manage, and scale NFT operations fast and affordably. It can be thought of as the NFT super-highway; buying, selling, trading and utilizing NFT's to their full potential is the priority.

networks.name: elysium
networks.description: Elysium is a new chain, retaining the characteristics of EVM compatible chains built on the substrate core framework. Elysium is much more than just an EVM implementation: it’s a highly specialized Layer 1 chain that mirrors Ethereum’s Web3 RPC, accounts, keys, subscriptions, logs, and more.

networks.name: elysium-testnet
networks.description: Elysium is a new chain, retaining the characteristics of EVM compatible chains built on the substrate core framework. Elysium is much more than just an EVM implementation: it’s a highly specialized Layer 1 chain that mirrors Ethereum’s Web3 RPC, accounts, keys, subscriptions, logs, and more.

networks.name: equilibrium
networks.description: Equilibrium is introducing the first cross-chain money market that combines pooled lending with synthetic asset generation and trading.

networks.name: frequency
networks.description: Frequency enables Web3 social at scale and is the first production implementation of the Decentralized Social Networking Protocol (DSNP.org). Frequency is designed so that applications collaborate instead of competing when submitting transactions.

networks.name: frequency-testnet
networks.description: Frequency enables Web3 social at scale and is the first production implementation of the Decentralized Social Networking Protocol (DSNP.org). Frequency is designed so that applications collaborate instead of competing when submitting transactions.

networks.name: foucoco
networks.description: Foucoco - Pendulum's Rococo testnet

networks.name: gear-testnet
networks.description: Gear is an advanced WASM based smart contract platform, aiming to be a Polkadot and Kusama parachain, that enables developers to deploy their dApps in under 5 minutes in the easiest and most efficient way possible.

networks.name: gemini-2a-testnet
networks.description: Subspace Network is a massively scalable infrastructure for Web3 that will empower and connect other blockchain ecosystems. Core use cases will include data availability for rollups on Ethereum (to start with), archival storage for all layer ones, and trustless cross-chain bridging to enable a true multi-chain future. Applications on any blockchain ecosystem can leverage the Subspace Network to connect to other ecosystems without migrating their current implementations.

networks.name: gmordie
networks.description: GMorDie is a blockchain to test the boundaries of what Dotsama can really do.

networks.name: hashed
networks.description: Hashed Network enables the full lifecycle for digitally-native organizations and web3-curious businesses seeking benefits of decentralized digital economies.

networks.name: heiko
networks.description: Heiko Finance is the sister network to Parallel Finance. Parallel Finance is a decentralized money market protocol that offers lending, staking, and borrowing in the Polkadot ecosystem.

networks.name: hydradx
networks.description: HydraDX is built as a parachain — specialized blockchain in the Polkadot network. It is benefiting from shared security, speed and flexibility of the Substrate framework while remaining optimized for a single purpose: enabling fluid programmable value exchange.

networks.name: hydradx-snakenet
networks.description: HydraDX is built as a parachain — specialized blockchain in the Polkadot network. It is benefiting from shared security, speed and flexibility of the Substrate framework while remaining optimized for a single purpose: enabling fluid programmable value exchange.

networks.name: imbue
networks.description: Imbue Network is a decentralised crowdfunding DAO built on top of the Polkadot blockchain platform. It is an idea incubator open to the entire world that allows anyone, from any walk of life and for any kind of endeavour, to submit and vote on Ideas worth funding from the communities that believe in them the most.

networks.name: integritee-network
networks.description: Integritee is the most scalable public blockchain solution for securely processing sensitive business or personal data. Harness the speed and confidentiality of trusted execution environments, combined with the trust of a decentralized network, with Integritee.

networks.name: interlay
networks.description: Interlay is a decentralized network dedicated to connecting crypto-currencies like Bitcoin with DeFi platforms like Polkadot and Ethereum. The Interlay network is hosted as a Polkadot parachain and will be connected to Cosmos, Ethereum, and other major DeFi networks.

networks.name: invarch-tinkernet
networks.description: The Tinkernet Parachain is the canary network of the InvArch Network, designed as the IP Asset & accelerated development staging grounds for the Kusama ecosystem.

networks.name: joystream
networks.description: Joystream is Web3 video platform DAO.

networks.name: kabocha
networks.description: Kabocha is Edgeware's parachain candidate for Kusama and continues Edgeware’s Substrate governance and treasury experiment by accelerating founders, creators and teams building open and public subverses and metaverses of Web3.

networks.name: karura
networks.description: Karura is the all-in-one DeFi hub of Kusama. Founded by the Acala Foundation, Karura is a scalable, EVM-compatible network optimized for DeFi.

networks.name: khala
networks.description: Khala Network tackles the issue of trust in the computation cloud. This blockchain is a trustless computation platform that enables massive cloud processing without sacrificing data confidentiality.

networks.name: kilt
networks.description: KILT is an open-source fat blockchain protocol for issuing claim-based verifiable, revocable, and anonymous credentials in the Web 3.0. It allows end users to claim arbitrary attributes about themselves, get them attested by trusted entities, and store the claims as self-sovereign credentials (certificates).

networks.name: kintsugi
networks.description: Kintsugi is interBTC`s canary network, developed by Interlay under the supervision of Kintsugi Labs, a non-profit oriented organization responsible for Kintsugi`s launch and the support of the decentralized network and ecosystem.

networks.name: kylin
networks.description: Kylin Network is a synergistic multi-level oracle data infrastructure built on Polkadot, democratizing the whole chain of data management processes required by all web3 middleware.

networks.name: litentry
networks.description: Litentry is a decentralized cross-chain Identity Aggregator that enables linking user identities across multiple networks.

networks.name: litmus
networks.description: Litmus is a companion canary network to Litentry, connects to the Kusama ecosystem. Litentry is a decentralized cross-chain Identity Aggregator that enables linking user identities across multiple networks.

networks.name: mangata-x
networks.description: Mangata X is a community-owned exchange for experienced traders & experimental tokens.

networks.name: moonbeam
networks.description: Moonbeam makes it easy to build decentralized applications on Polkadot — which means your DApps can integrate with other blockchains, including Bitcoin and Ethereum.

networks.name: moonriver
networks.description: The network`s Kusama deployment will be called Moonriver, and have its own utility token which is called River. Supply and other token economic behaviors on Moonriver will be the same as Moonbeam, but token distribution will be different in order to support the unique goals and attributes of the network.

networks.name: myriad
networks.description: A social metaverse & metasocial network on web3, pulling content from mainstream social media and turning every post into a tipping wallet.

networks.name: myriad-testnet
networks.description: Testnet for a social metaverse & metasocial network Myriad.

networks.name: nodle
networks.description: Nodle leverages Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) via millions of smartphones and routers to allow enterprises and smart cities to connect IoT devices to the Internet at a low-cost while maintaining privacy and security.

networks.name: opal
networks.description: Unique Network provides an Opal Testnet to it's users in order to play with all blockchain features in a safe and free of network fees environment.

networks.name: origin-trail
networks.description: OriginTrail brought a scalable, trusted and secure way for information to be shared across a universe of data sources, bringing together users that were traditionally not able to perform data management in such a way.

networks.name: pangolin
networks.description: Pangolin is a multi-chain decentralized digital assets exchange (DEX). Through advanced tooling, deep liquidity, and smooth onboarding, Pangolin offers easy swaps and great tools for projects and traders.

networks.name: parallel
networks.description: Parallel is Lending Protocol and Staking Protocol Supporting both Kusama and Polkadot assets.

networks.name: peaq
networks.description: peaq network is a smart contract platform built on Substrate supporting ink! and Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) smart contracts.

networks.name: pendulum
networks.description: Pendulum is an open-source blockchain that aims to establish the missing link between the fiat and the DeFi ecosystems through a fiat-optimized smart contract blockchain.

networks.name: phala
networks.description: Phala Network is a decentralized cloud that offers secure and scalable computing. This blockchain is a trustless computation platform that enables massive cloud processing without sacrificing data confidentiality.

networks.name: pichiu
networks.description: Pichiu is Kylin's Network canary parachain on Kusama.

networks.name: picasso
networks.description: Picasso plays a fundamental role in maximizing the potential of Kusama and Polkadot by providing cross-chain DeFi infrastructure and trustless bridging solutions through the extension of the Inter-blockchain Communication Protocol (IBC) beyond the Cosmos ecosystem. In doing so, Picasso is able to act as the infrastructure layer enabling interoperable DeFi through which developers can pioneer cross-chain smart contracts with Composable’s Cross-chain Virtual Machine (XCVM). The XCVM is able to leverage the aforementioned infrastructure and communication protocols to facilitate asset transfers and cross-chain function calls between ecosystems connected to Picasso.

networks.name: polkadex
networks.description: Polkadex Orderbook is a non-custodial, peer-to-peer trading platform that merges the benefits of both centralized and decentralized exchanges into a next-generation decentralized product suite.

networks.name: quartz
networks.description: The canary network of Unique Network, Quartz, gives you quick and easy access to the full spectrum of essential and advanced NFT Tools.

networks.name: reef
networks.description: Layer 1, EVM compatible, based on Substrate framework. Scalable with low transactions and fast block time.

networks.name: reef-testnet
networks.description: Testnet for L1 Substrate based EVM compatible chain with multi VM support.

networks.name: robonomics
networks.description: The creation and development of a platform that provides tools for working with the robot economy network (briefly - the Robonomics platform) will allow designers of new cities and industrial zones to build trust among the autonomous robots services, provide direct user access for ordering products from autonomous factories and services of urban sensor networks.

networks.name: rococo
networks.description: Rococo is Polkadot's Parachain Testnet. Rococo is designed strictly for testing parachain functionality.

networks.name: shibuya
networks.description: Shibuya is a web3 content studio and creator platform. Unlike traditional streaming platforms, Shibuya is built with decentralization as a priority and uses blockchain technology to securely distribute and monetize content.

networks.name: shiden
networks.description: Shiden Network is a multi-chain decentralized application layer on Kusama Network. Kusama Relaychain does not support smart contract functionality by design - Kusama Network needs a smart contract layer.

networks.name: snow
networks.description: SNOW is a long-term incentivized network for cutting-edge development backed by the ICZ token, which has real-world value. SNOW will serve as a ‘canary network’ for ICE. SNOW comes packed with a set of top tier features such as full EVM and eWASM-compatibility, BTP cross-chain interoperability optimization and the backing of a vibrant L1 community.

networks.name: sora
networks.description: SORA is both a new economic system that decentralizes the concept of a central bank as well as a network in the Polkadot ecosystem that will connect to the Polkadot relay chain and the parachains with built-in tools focused on DeFi.

networks.name: statemine
networks.description: Statemine is the Kusama instance of Polkadot`s Statemint parachain, a common-good chain which allows the hosting of arbitrary assets, both fungible and non-fungible. It also serves as a low-cost chain for keeping and transferring the Relay Chain`s native token (KSM/DOT).

networks.name: statemint
networks.description: Statemint, Parity Technologies` generic assets parachain, will be proposed as one of the first “common good” parachains for the Polkadot network. It will provide functionality for deploying assets and entail far lower fees than other solutions.

networks.name: subsocial
networks.description: An open platform for decentralized social networks and marketplaces. It's censorship-resistant and has built-in monetization methods. Built with Polkadot and IPFS tech stack.

networks.name: t0rn
networks.description: t3rn creates frictionless multichain smartcontract execution, that's accountable, scalable, and completely trust-free for investors, users, and developers.

networks.name: tanganika
networks.description: DataHighway is a decentralized Web3 organization specializing in the gathering and trading of Internet of Things (IoT) Data NFTs and F-NFTs. DataHighway is currently building an Inter-Chain Data Marketplace on the Kusama Network (after winning a Parachain slot last year on the Polkadot Ecosystem) where users will be able to share IoT Data with each other while trading them with DHX Tokens. The reason behind us choosing data is because the data industry now constitutes a billion dollar industry and we want everyone to be able to access this exciting opportunity.

networks.name: ternoa
networks.description: Ternoa allows you to create time capsules from your smartphone and easily with images, videos or messages. Each time capsule is encrypted and decentralized stored on the Ternoa blockchain for the purpose of transferring it to beneficiaries.

networks.name: tidechain
networks.description: The Tidechain is our custom-built, layer-1 blockchain created atop the Substrate framework. Designed with the intention of massive scalability and interoperability, the Tidechain is truly future-proof allowing for the highest level of reliability, security, and potential for growth.

networks.name: turing
networks.description: Being a canary network of OAK, Turing Network aims to drive product usage of XCM by providing cross-chain automation for other parachains.

networks.name: unique
networks.description: Unique Network is a scalable blockchain for marketplaces, games and dApps with advanced features, built for Polkadot.

networks.name: vara
networks.description: Vara is a fast and scalable Layer-1 decentralized network powered by Gear Protocol. The best playground for developing and running your dApps. Gear Protocol is an advanced WASM based smart contract platform capable of being deployed as a Kusama and Polkadot parachain, that enables developers to deploy their dApps in under 5 minutes in the easiest and most efficient way possible.

networks.name: xx-network
networks.description: xx network is a fast, low-fee quantum-ready layer 1 blockchain built in tandem with the most private communications network in the world (cMix). Founded by the godfather of digital currency and privacy technology David Chaum, the xx network mainnet launched in November 2021. Nominated Proof-of-Stake (NPoS) incentivizes coin holders to run and elect nodes as well as to participate in the governance of the platform via on-chain DAO.

networks.name: zeitgeist
networks.description: Zeitgeist is a decentralized network for creating, betting on, and resolving prediction markets. The platform's native currency, the ZTG, is used to sway the direction of the network, and as a means of last-call dispute resolution.
